programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Following a lead from their Belize connection, the team heads out in search of a Go Fast - an expensive boat used to smuggle drugs overseas at high speed.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Brandon reconsiders his future in the rescue business after a close call. The newest member of the Jamie Davis team puts his life on the line to stop a speeding semi on an icy road.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike finds a rare retro motor in a West Virginia museum, and takes a fancy to an electronic peacock.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a gamble by buying an elephant's head from a taxidermist, and the guys are tempted to purchase an antique hot dog steamer.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Ten men plunge into the wilderness with only a backpack, where they are forced to hunt, fend off predators and endure extreme isolation.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Two men remain on the island as the storm of the year blows in. The weather, isolation and starvation prove too much for one contestant in the season finale.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' Rick Harrison seeks the team's help in making a couch out of a car as a birthday present for his son.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Big Mike brings a 1960s motorcycle into the shop, and the guys search for rare parts to restore it, while Rick works on an arcade game.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate the similarities in burial tombs from distant cultures, and question whether aliens could have influenced their complicated designs.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigations into whether prophets such as Elijah and Joseph Smith communicated with a heavenly source, or came into contact with extraterrestrials.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle go treasure hunting in Virginia, in search of bargains to stock their new shop.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a crumbling building full of salvaged gems, but have a hard time getting the valuables out safely before the roof caves in.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton Jones and Allen Haff try to make a profit by selling a 19th-century Colt Peacemaker pistol, a Depression-era slot machine and a customised mini-bike.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders discover a valuable 1970s Fender Stratocaster guitar and a rare Schwinn bicycle from the 1930s.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton Jones and Allen Haff run into an old rival at a storage auction, and also acquire a vintage GMC truck and a contraption that could be the first ever Coca-Cola vending machine.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders head to Hollywood, where they try to make a profit by selling a set of vintage Masonic swords, a polygraph machine and a Second World War samurai blade.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton Jones believes he has found whiskey in a gallon flagon, that was smuggled by Al Capone in the 1920s - but cannot decide whether to sell the alcohol or consume it.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton Jones and Allen Haff head to California, where they acquire a 1940s arcade game, a Winchester shotgun and an antique crossbow.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Behind the scenes as Ton and Allen show how to profile a room and be the best Auction Hunter you can be.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: On a visit to San Bernardino, California, Ton Jones uncovers a Victorian pepper-box revolver - but the weapon will only turn a profit if he manages to make it capable of firing.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to downtown Los Angeles, and whilst bidding on storage units uncover a rare copper cash converter and a 1970s German H&K P7 pistol.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Auctions in Lake Elsinore bring treasures for some and turmoil for others, Dave causes trouble for his rivals, and Rene and Jarrod go head to head.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to auctions in Santa Ana, and once back on familiar turf, Dave Hester makes the others fight for a decent locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Too Many Cooks in the Locker
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at auctions in Lancaster, where Mary chooses a surprising ally. Meanwhile, Jarrod and Brandi turn up the pressure.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave threatens to dampen high spirits at an early morning auction, and Mary struggles to stop the other buyers from getting her down.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers have big dreams of making it in Hollywood. Despite his hatred of Tinseltown, Dave takes a major gamble on an unusual locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to a first-class auction in Arcadia, but when bids quickly start reaching into the thousands, Mary is left struggling to keep up.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers go back to Montebello, where some of their biggest finds and greatest dramas have occurred.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hope for hidden treasures at auctions in Moreno Valley, as Dave attempts to make his mark on new territory, while Mary tries out a risky new idea.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
programme.desc: As Beth continues her fight against cancer, the hunt for Willie Boy continues. His behaviour has taken a dangerous turn, and tracking him down isn't going to be easy.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked with forging a signature blade from W2 steel and a giant industrial-sized nut. Their blades must survive a brutal Forged in Fire first when they face not one, but two unforgiving strength tests. Only two smiths advance and head back to their home forges to recreate an iconic ancient iron weapon - the Celtic Anthropomorphic Sword.

programme.title: The Curse of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: The team unearths evidence of a secret tunnel while new clues suggest a deeper mystery than just the missing Confederate gold.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has stainless steel jewellery coming to the shop, but Ashley refuses to sell it - until she is forced to do so by her cousin Karen.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Cousin Karen is ready to shake things up on the showroom floor, but Ashley is less than thrilled to have someone invading her turf.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Les takes his niece Karen under his wing to help out at the jewellery counter, Ashley fails to conceal her jealousy well.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth thinks Les is stuck in the past for hand-delivering their gold to a refinery, and bets his father that his new mail order service will improve things.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: IT Crowd star and The Crystal Maze host Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedy writer Andy Hamilton one of the guests joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Mirthful musings on life with the laptop-literate comedian, as Dave ponders society's image obsession and investigates how far people will go for fame.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy think they have bought the perfect Christmas present for seven-year old Charlie and five-year-old twins Benji and Molly. However, their pride in their parenting is short-lived when the youngsters' grandparents buy exactly the same gift and beat them to the punch by handing it over on Christmas Eve. Lee ventures into the streets on the night before Christmas and faces a desperate race against time to find a suitable replacement. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in a festive episode of the sitcom.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: Jon is troubled by technology. James Acaster and David O'Doherty address his worries about smartphones, becoming a viral sensation and boozing in virtual pubs.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: In the final episode, Brian joins the Munty Reserve forces, while Barbara and Steg find their own groups to enlist with.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle take downhill mountain-bike racing to the next level by adding more wheels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May are challenged to create a TV advert for Volkswagen, but soon fall out as James concentrates on detailed information on fuel economy and Jeremy wants something more exciting. Richard Hammond explores an alternative to Germanic sports saloons and tests the Vauxhall VXR8 Bathurst, and former US chat show host Jay Leno is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test-drive an Aston Martin DBS Convertible, a Ferrari California and a Lamborghini Gallardo Convertible through Romania, searching for the mountain highway built during the reign of the country's former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu - allegedly the best road to drive on in the world. Actor Eric Bana is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith engages in a high-speed pursuit after spotting a car being driven with a flat tyre. Even after the tyre disintegrates at 90mph, the driver still refuses to stop.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A 999 call from a teenager sparks a race against time for Nadiene and volunteer Matt. When confronted with an aggressive man, the pair are forced to hit their emergency buttons.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys meet a man who had pieces on display in the Smithsonian, but find that what he has held on to is even more mind-blowing.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In California, the guys deal with a collector who is under pressure to downsize, and later play a hunch that turns up a lot of rare vintage cars.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Dara O Briain, Denise Van Outen, Rhod Gilbert and Vernon Kay, who try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Charles Dance, Stephen Mangan, Isy Suttie and Gok Wan join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Warwick Davis, Paul Hollywood, Jason Manford and Joan Bakewell join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Seattle, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A new recruit fresh out of training school makes her mark when she uncovers 12kg of cocaine hidden in a car that she has stopped on one of the bridges.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: More than 100 boxes full of drugs are discovered inside an unlikely vehicle at the World Trade Bridge. In Progreso, a suspected gang member attempts to cross into the United States.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: IT Crowd star and The Crystal Maze host Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedy writer Andy Hamilton one of the guests joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Joe Lycett, Phil Wang and Ellie Taylor join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig looks at the pastimes of past times. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian tests his preconceptions of Albania, guided on a whistlestop tour of the country by local TV presenter and journalist Erjona Rusi. Along the way, he tries to discover why Albania has remained a stubbornly unfashionable holiday destination, meeting those at the extremes of the country, from the rural farmers to the billionaire playboys who live in the cities in the company of supermodels.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the incredible machines built to get troops directly to the front line, on land, at sea and in the air.

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Anne Frank and Eva Schloss, whose lives intertwined during the darkest of period of 20th-century history. Eva, who met Anne in Amsterdam in 1938, survived Auschwitz and here talks about her memories of the young diarist, her survival from the death camps, and how she became the step daughter of Anne's Father, Otto Frank.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the staff of Moses, one of the more astonishing miracles depicted in the Bible as Moses turned his staff into a snake.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Questions regarding the authenticity of the Jehoash Tablet, a religious artifact containing an ancient inscription.

programme.title: Waterloo Dead
programme.desc: Two hundred years after the Battle of Waterloo, investigators Tim Sutherland, Malin Holst and Simon Richardson employ forensic techniques to uncover surprising secrets from one of the greatest military encounters of all time.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Guy Walters explores Hitler's plans for the future after the Second World War, beginning by revealing what Britain under Nazi occupation would have looked like.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: A look at Hitler's plans to build ambitious new cities in the countries he conquered, as well as schemes to transform Berlin to serve as a global capital city.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Hitler's plans to invade the US using battleships, long-range bombers and secret infiltrators. Plus, a look at support for the Nazi movement in America during the 1940s.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Hitler's vision of the ideal citizen of the Third Reich, using breeding programmes and special schools to promote Aryan racial traits and complete devotion to his regime.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: How Hitler used recreation to promote his ideology, setting up the world's largest beach resort and travel agency and attempting to turn the Olympics into a propaganda tool.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The gun battle on the thoroughfares of London in 1911 known as the Siege of Sidney Street. Four hundred rounds of ammunition were fired over six hours in one of the earliest news incidents to be captured by motion camera.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Part two of two. A re-examination of Jack the Ripper's crimes, revealing how the story known today was shaped by the sensationalist press of 1888. Featuring contributions from Ripper expert Donald Rumbelow and writer Hallie Rubenhold, author of The Five - the only book to tell the lives of the victims.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Officer Crabtree finally releases Rene, Mimi and the British airmen from the handcuffs, and the Germans order the cafe owner to arrange a meeting to sell the Fallen Madonna painting - but things do not quite go according to plan.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Newlyweds Fanny and Leclerc are jailed by the Germans for flying around in a bed attached to a balloon. Rene is horrified when Edith resolves to rescue them, but her plans are thwarted by a loose bedknob. Second World War comedy, starring Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General von Flockenstoffen decides to launch a raid to capture Churchill, leaving the Colonel, Gruber and Bertorelli to resort to desperate measures to stop him.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A brother and sister stand accused of murdering their father and stepmother, and pleading for them proves to be the most complex assignment of Kavanagh's entire career. The task is made doubly difficult by the man's insistence on defending himself and a tragedy within his own family - and Julia's decision to leave chambers does not help either. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Anna Chancellor and Art Malik.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth delves into a suspicious death, while loyal sidekick Geoffrey and her put-upon husband Robert become involved in a delicate undercover operation. While the police seem satisfied that there was no foul play, the dead man's brother believes that the housekeeper is a fraud who has systematically stolen property from him.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth is called upon to mediate in a dispute at a condemned block of flats, and soon discovers the man responsible for their construction has a shady past. Further investigations send the part-time sleuth on a tense race against time as she strives to prevent the cowboy builder from profiting from his shoddy work. Detective drama, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The medic resolves to track down a mysterious man who callously ignored his request to call for an ambulance - and Finlay's obsession soon leads him into a macabre world. Drama, starring David Rintoul.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The trail of evidence against Colin Fairfax leads Jack Meadows and Jo Masters to a potentially explosive confrontation with him in a lock-up garage full of petrol cans. Yvonne gets wind of Scott's romantic entanglement with Honey and confides in Steve Hunter her suspicions about his cool reaction to the news of his wife's murder. Serial rapist Alan Kennedy demands an interview with Sam Nixon, claiming he has been receiving death threats.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The spectre of racial unrest looms over Sun Hill following a number of assaults on the Muslim community, allegedly committed by white youths. Hoping to defuse the situation, Leela persuades her father to tell the police he witnessed an Asian man carry out one of the attacks - and later finds him beaten senseless. As the three officers killed in the explosion are laid to rest, Neil arouses his wife's suspicions by attending Andrea's funeral, while Laura is unconvinced by Gabriel's whiter-than-white demeanour.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leela urges her hospitalised father to make a statement about his attackers, and is warned her own life is in danger - which only increases her determination to pursue the case to the bitter end. Jo goes on the trail of a violent pimp and offers a local prostitute the chance to become a police informant, while Gabriel shows his compassionate side by protecting a little girl he suspects is being abused. Honey brushes aside Yvonne's concerns about her engagement to Scott, putting it down to jealousy - unaware of Yvonne's budding romance with A&E nurse Nick.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina faces the ultimate test of character when she learns she has cervical cancer, but is determined to maintain her hard-as-nails demeanour in public. Leela considers leaving the force when it becomes apparent that the chances of convicting drug dealer Salim Haq are slim, while Jo's investigation into a rival villain uncovers ominous evidence of gang warfare. Elsewhere, Gabriel sets out to prove schoolgirl Gemma is being abused by her stepmother - and finds an ally in Sheelagh.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth delves into a suspicious death, while loyal sidekick Geoffrey and her put-upon husband Robert become involved in a delicate undercover operation. While the police seem satisfied that there was no foul play, the dead man's brother believes that the housekeeper is a fraud who has systematically stolen property from him.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth is called upon to mediate in a dispute at a condemned block of flats, and soon discovers the man responsible for their construction has a shady past. Further investigations send the part-time sleuth on a tense race against time as she strives to prevent the cowboy builder from profiting from his shoddy work. Detective drama, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: First in a two-part special. The story picks up in August 1844, two years after Miss Matty lost her beloved sister Deborah. Mr Buxton has returned to live quietly in Cranford following the death of his wife, although Miss Matty is concerned about his relationship with his son as neither seem to be coping with their bereavement. The local busybody is also worried about Peggy Bell, who lives in an isolated cottage looking after her inattentive mother and domineering brother, so she hatches a plot to bring these young residents together. However, the surprise arrival of Lady Ludlow's son Lord Septimus leads to a chain of unexpected events concerning the looming railway, and a tragedy at Matty's own house forces her to re-evaluate her opinions on the subject. Judi Dench and Jonathan Pryce star.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part special. The women of Cranford are excited about the imminent visit of Lady Glenmire, until the Hon Mrs Jamieson announces that none of them is of high enough social standing to meet her - so Miss Matty leads the Amazons in snubbing both the newcomer and her hostess. But sociable Lady Glenmire is quick to offer an olive branch by hosting a memorable Halloween party, which results in the forging of new friendships. Mr Buxton is impressed by Edward Bell's ambitions, so takes him on as land agent, only for the new employee to make a disastrous decision that has dire consequences for both himself and his sister Peggy. Meanwhile, Matty is distressed when a surprising discovery about one of her close circle results in a serious falling out among the friends, and when tragedy strikes the town, she fears Cranford may never recover. Judi Dench, Celia Imrie and Jonathan Pryce star.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. An unpopular colonel is found dead in the vicarage of St Mary Mead and investigations reveal no shortage of suspects - including the vicar and members of the victim's family. Christmas edition from 1986, starring Joan Hickson, Paul Eddington and James Hazeldine.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A newlywed, recently arrived in England from New Zealand, sees disturbing visions of a strangled corpse in the hallway of her dream home. Joan Hickson stars as the amateur detective determined to get to the bottom of the mystery.

programme.title: The Casual Vacancy
programme.desc: As the parish council election approaches, the townsfolk are on tenterhooks, awaiting the next post from 'the Ghost of Barry Fairbrother'. Who is behind the internet messages and what will they say next? In an attempt to smooth things over, Samantha throws a dinner party for all the warring factions, but when Howard and Shirley unexpectedly arrive things quickly spiral out of control. Across in the Fields, Terri seems to be over her addiction, giving Krystal hope of a new future for her family. Drama adapted from the novel by JK Rowling, starring Michael Gambon, Keeley Hawes, Abigail Lawrie and Keeley Forsyth.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: The RMP begins a desperate search, as Tilbrook takes Markham to visit a very important prisoner and Ed receives intelligence that puts his life in danger. Alison confides in Honor about her affair as she finds herself unable to continue with her pregnancy.

programme.title: Pitch Perfect (2012)
programme.desc: A new student finds herself a social outcast during her first year of college, but soon acquires a new circle of friends in a band of misfits with a shared talent for singing. She joins their a cappella group and leads them to compete in the campus music competitions. Comedy, starring Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Elizabeth Banks.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Brian McFadden is at the home of pop star and actor Adam Rickitt as he plays host to four strangers in his home. Will Adam avoid the washing up with his cryptic clues as to his identity or will the four diners bag the cash prize and hand the rubber gloves to him?.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Can Danny handle the pressure of performing basketball tricks in front of hundreds of fans and avoid the messy forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo is handing out food to the neighbourhood animals when he stumbles on a gigantic hamster that Fizz has released from some parallel dimension..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo can't find the book that Linda lent him and he's ready to turn the house upside down to find it. The problem is that he's actually in Fizz's loft..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, thinking he's at the laundromat, wanders into a candy factory, where Fizz and Weasel are creating a bubblegum that makes Fizz-shaped bubbles..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The Great Eduardo, violinist supreme, is in town and Irma wants to go to the concert. But Bean won't pay for the tickets. More than that, he claims that he can play the violin better.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.desc: The students meet the first four constellations in the hopes of learning how to defeat Jindiao..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott presents the first of two visits to Antigua, where he gets masterclasses in cocktail mixing and playing steel pans, meeting the leader of one of the island's first steel pan bands. He also gets a taste of a Caribbean specialty from the owner of a roadside food stall and mixes a sunset rum punch on the beach.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up pastaball marinara - their take on meatballs in tomato sauce - baked banana French toast topped with berry compote, crispy chilli tofu and special fried rice, and peanut butter and jelly chocolate brownies. Their guest is chef Meriel Armitage, who prepares barbecue glazed jackfruit ribs.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create an elegant tea garden for a charity volunteer in Birmingham who makes cakes for injured members of the services. The garden includes a fully equipped kitchen so she can bake pies and cakes in the fresh air, raised beds for growing fresh ingredients, and a colourful living wall. Plus, Katie Rushworth offers tips on balcony and rooftop gardening.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Documentary following locals in the Pembrokeshire community as they try to cope with the busiest summer season in history, with tourists flocking to the UK's smallest city as a place of pilgrimage, a wildlife haven and an adventurer's paradise.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the third and final episode of the Battle rounds. Coaches Will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions go head to head and fight for their place on their coach's team. The singers that impress their coach the most remain in the competition, but those that aren't so lucky can still be stolen by another coach.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Jax Jones and Ella Henderson perform live at the start of this week's entertainment extravaganza, while the hosts face a dance battle with Britain's Got Talent: The Champions winners Twist & Pulse in the End of the Show Show. Plus, Stephen Mulhern returns for Ant vs Dec Goes Global, one lucky audience member plays to Win the Ads and the Men in Brown continue on their mission to track down which mystery celebrity has The Squits. More deserving audience members and viewers at home also win a Place on the Plane.

programme.title: Liar Liar (1997)
programme.desc: A lawyer whose underhand ploys to win cases leave him little time to see his son discovers he is incapable of lying after the boy's birthday wish makes his dad tell only the truth. However, this causes a host of problems as the attorney tries to muddle his way through a high-profile divorce settlement. Comedy, with Jim Carrey, Maura Tierney, Justin Cooper, Jennifer Tilly and Cary Elwes.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: PhillipSchofield and Holly Willoughby host the grand final of the skating challenge. Three celebrities and their professional partners remain in the contest, and each pair is challenged to perform a special showcase routine choreographed by Christopher Dean and Jayne Torvill. After that one pair will be eliminated, with the other going on to the final round - performing their own take on Torvill and Dean's signature piece, Ravel's Bolero. And as if that were not enough, the entire cast of this year's show will return to the ice for one last performance.

programme.title: McDonald & Dodds
programme.desc: The chalk-and-cheese detective duo are called to a private clinic where a wealthy patient has been killed. However, their investigation is made all the more difficult by the complex relationships of the victim's former fellow residents. Jason Watkins and Tala Gouveia take the lead roles in the second of two mystery dramas, with an all-star supporting cast including Caroline Catz, Hugh Dennis, Michele Dotrice, Freddie Fox, Suzanne Packer and Joanna Scanlan.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp welcomes Nick Knowles and Rita Simons to Sandbanks, where they pay a visit to the nearby British Beach Polo Championships, and even get the chance to sit in a saddle. The following day, Harry visits his neighbour, celebrity interior designer Celia Sawyer, who gives him a tour of her harbour-front house.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Six-part drama following the lives of residents in the close-knit coastal resort of Thurlbury. Local historian Maggie Cole is flattered when she is interviewed for a radio show about village life, but she inadvertently shares too much detail about the locals and their private lives. Starring Dawn French and Julie Hesmondhalgh.

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: Jill Douglas presents action from the fourth round of fixtures, featuring England v Wales at Twickenham and Scotland v France at Murrayfield.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Political heavyweight John Prescott navigates Liverpool in his first set of wheels and revisits the scene of an infamous punch up in his former government motor..

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New mining team The Tunnel Rats blasts its way to a fortune and solo prospector Col Duff gets stranded deep in the Queensland outback. Rookie Sam runs out of air underground.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Sergeant Major and Sully move two large boiler houses from the West Midlands to Bristol. However, the pressure is felt as they reverse their ultra-delicate cargo through a tiny yard.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team is nominated for an award, but a lack of production bikes causes the crew to work overtime to build more in time for the award showcase.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: The FantomWorks team dives into prototype hell to give a former drag racer the superfast 1969 Chevelle of his dreams - complete with a supercharged LT4 engine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer claims ownership of a 1973 Ford Mustang Mach 1, and mechanic Ant Anstead tries to restore its lost power by tuning up and enhancing the engine.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Replica Clay Pipes/Drinking Fountains/Orange Liqueur/Compound Bows
programme.desc: How replica clay pipes, drinking fountains, orange liqueur and compound bows are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How tissues, travel trailers, slippers and motorcycle helmets are made, and how manufacturing processes have developed over the years.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: Deadly Dragon of Borneo: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: The story of a serpent that prowls Borneo's waterways, hunting children as they swim. Mungo tries to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien finds a barn containing a collection of replica Rolls-Royce cars, and Henry Cole tries his hand at driving a tractor as they continue their money-making tour.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer claims ownership of a 1973 Ford Mustang Mach 1, and mechanic Ant Anstead tries to restore its lost power by tuning up and enhancing the engine.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: Colin Murray introduces a round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Leeds United v Hudderfield Town and Swansea City v West Browmich Albion.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Pickers Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a massive warehouse in Chicago filled with cast-off treasures, including some superstar sports memorabilia that are a 'total slam dunk'.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Some of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's finest finds and most premium picks in this series showcasing the best of their adventures.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz travel all over in search of rare items that have shaped America, selecting the most interesting, rare and potentially profitable treasures to bring home.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's finest finds and most premium picks in the first series, showcasing the best of their adventures and ultimate restorations.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Pickers Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a massive warehouse in Chicago filled with cast-off treasures, including some superstar sports memorabilia that are a 'total slam dunk'.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Dave has his dream '57 Corvette, but his plans to build it have come to nothing. Meanwhile, Ken has picked a 1954 Kaiser Darrin from his father's collection.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a budget Nissan Skyline supercar and Edd China sets about transforming it into a home-made drift racer.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien finds a barn containing a collection of replica Rolls-Royce cars, and Henry Cole tries his hand at driving a tractor as they continue their money-making tour.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Three British farmers try to run three very different family farms across the UK, experiencing the challenges and rewards that come with making a living off the land.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard enjoys a rare chance to scour the wild items at Chester Zoo. Later in Leicestershire, he unearths a royal relic.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: In the Southern Andes, the team uncovers the town of Bariloche and the Inalco House, where Hitler could have stayed. Using network and financial analysis the team descends on Hotel Eden, a compound owned by two known and documented Nazi supporters, where an eyewitness claims to have seen Hitler, months after his supposed death.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: How, on a freezing Minnesota night, a ruthless shooting left a young police officer fighting for his life by the road. A tense manhunt for the three suspects ensued.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The cases of a woman's death and the abduction of a young boy help to illustrate how co-operation from the public can help forensic investigators.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: A complex case emerges when bones are found on a naval base, and after detectives uncover a family feud and sinister conspiracy, they are overwhelmed by motives for the murder.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Claypool Hill, Virginia, where a popular pizza restaurant was turned into a horrific crime scene. The clues pointed to something more sinister than a robbery gone wrong, and authorities realised they had to move quickly to catch the killer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of how the FBI brought to justice a group of Lebanese terrorists who hijacked a grounded plane in 1985.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Emergency Animal Medical Technician Laura Hackett deals with one of the worst cases of cruelty she has ever seen when she rescues a dog that has been brutally attacked. It is close to death after being beaten and stabbed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa is tasked with saving a five-year-old's paralysed dachshund, while Dr Chris is presented with a list by another little girl.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bre is set on a traditional gown, while Jennifer knows the exact dress for her. Elsewhere, Susan finally gets to make her dream wedding a reality after a 20-year wait.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I've Stalked This Dress on Instagram!
programme.desc: Hayley Paige makes three unique dress in one day, while a bride is determined to have her design a gown for her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Am a Bride on a Budget
programme.desc: A struggling actress resolves to pay for her own dress, while a customer falls in love with a dress that is over her budget.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon Chris Brown visits the USA, where he meets a woman with the largest collection of pet cats he has ever seen and an eccentric skateboarding dog.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon Chris Brown deals with an oversexed rabbit that is giving out some unwanted attention. He also tries to outsmart Splodge, a dog with a knack of escaping from his owner's garden.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Gideon, who weighs 650lbs, is desperate to address his problem, so uproots his family to restart his life with weight-loss surgery and hopes for a happier future.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Dottie loves being a mother but, at over 600lbs, she's on the verge of leaving her two young children motherless. Cameras witness her as she takes drastic action in a bid to turn her life around.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: After losing over 200 pounds, Doug is now an active part of his family's lives. However, his eating disorder is once again threatening to derail his progress.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 45-year-old blues guitarist John Spira who vanished in February 2007, the day he had finalised his divorce. The investigation went cold, until a series of events thrust it back into the limelight.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride's mother wants her daughter to wear her wedding dress, but it does not fit. However, Jo and Al come up with a plan to solve the problem.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride who has never worn a dress before wants Jo and Al to find her something sparkly, but feels nervous wearing it.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride who has recently gained weight worries she will not fit into her dress, and only has four weeks before the big day.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride who hates trying on dresses in shops buys 10 gowns online instead - but finds she does not like any of them.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride has a medical condition that makes her unsteady on her feet, and fears she will not be able to walk down the aisle. Jo and Al alter her dress to make it easier for her.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride is unhappy with the train on her dress, and Jo and Al have very little time to put things right.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old Zach is rushed to hospital suffering from a mystery illness. Soon he is taken into emergency surgery.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Matt takes a job in IT to sort out the family's finances, but must continue to motivate himself despite no longer being his own boss.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Jackson Galaxy works with a mother and daughter whose cats are having a territorial spraying match. He also meets with trouble-making cat Bowie, who has been given his last chance.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The officers come to the rescue of six hungry horses, and try to rehouse an elderly grey mare called Grandma.

programme.title: Long Lost Family Australia
programme.desc: With only a hospital bracelet and a box of photos, 20-year-old Shantelle searches for her older sister. Plus, 46-year-old Natalieann looks for her father, who she hasn't seen since they stopped talking 24 years earlier. Presented by Chrissie Swan and Anh Do.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of Californian teacher Laci Peterson, who disappeared in December 2002 while eight months pregnant with her first child. Her husband Scott claimed he last saw her before he went fishing - but his secret mistress exposed his lies. Experts examine his behaviour.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Seana is 23 and nearly 700lbs, living at her mum's house, depressed and anxious. Dr Now can give her the tools she needs to live, but only she can save herself.
